title: George North forced out of Wales' Rugby World Cup semi-final despite trying to play on
text:
Wales wing George North was forced to come off in his side's Rugby World Cup semi-final defeat against South Africa after sustaining a hamstring injury.

Warren Gatland's side were trailing the Springboks 3-9 when the Ospreys player pulled up in the 38th minute with half-time looming.

After limping off the pitch, North was replaced by Owen Watkin, before Wales went on to lose 16-19 to the Springboks.

North winces in agony as he picks up a hamstring problem during the semi-final clash

Medics tend to the Ospreys man as he goes down after pulling up shortly before half time

The 27-year-old had slammed the ground in anger, knowing a hamstring issue would have likely ruled him out of a final in Yokohama next week.

But North will earn praise for valiantly trying to carry on and taking his position to help his team reach the final for the first time, although it became clear he could not continue as he limped around the turf.

Losing North rounded off a terrible five minutes for Wales after they also lost prop Tomos Francis to injury.

He had bravely attempted to play on to provide his side a boost but could not carry on

REPLACEMENT: Within minutes of Francis leaving the field, George North is replaced by Owen Watkin following a leg injury to the winger. 39 mins — Welsh Rugby Union 🏉 (@WelshRugbyUnion) October 27, 2019

The Exeter Chiefs player went in hard on South Africa's Duane Vermeulen but hurt himself in the process - having to be replaced by Dillon Lewis.

Francis was similarly furious after picking up the injury, also banging the turf, with his side so close to the final.

But Wales' heartbreak continued as their hopes of reaching a first World Cup final were crushed after being narrowly beaten by South Africa.
description: Warren Gatland's side were trailing the Springboks 6-9 when the Ospreys player pulled up in the 40th minute with half-time looming.
